text: Nidara croceina is a moth in the family Drepanidae. It was described by Paul Mabille in 1898. It is found on Madagascar. The length of the forewings is about 21 mm for males and 19 mm for females. Both wings are yellow with a large white spot and a trace of a second smaller white spot, both distal to the end of the cell. The hindwings are unmarked."A revision of the Ethiopian Drepanidae (Lepidoptera)". ==References== Category:Moths described in 1898 Category:Drepaninae
title: Nidara croceina
